status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
File->New Module Project -> Select target sdk to any 3.2.3,3.2.2,3.2.0. And create new module project

h3. Actual Result
Exception: No 'android-10' or 'android-2.3.3' in the Android SDK
Aborting

Module project not created

h3. Expected Result
Module project to be created
fields.summary: Unable to create a Titanium Android module from Windows: "Could not move"

comments.body:
We tried to reproduce this issue with a sample test case. It’s working as expected with Titanium 3.2.X.GA. 

h5. TESTING ENVIRONMENT:

Titanium SDK 3.2.X.GA
Ti CLI 3.2.3 
OS Windows 7 32bit


h5. STEPS TO TEST

1. Click File->New->Mobile Module Project
2. Fill Project Location Section
3. Next Fill Module Modification File
4. Click finish and module project created successfully.

h5. EXPECTED RESULT

It’s working as expected.

Thanks
Yes I have a android-10 installed in my Android SDK.

Now again if I am trying to create a module, after downloading all the android versions from 2.3 to 4.4 I am getting following error message.

Could not move: C:\Users\xxx\AppData\Local\Temp\module_temp1859809400254981097.tmp\modulemgr.
Could not move: C:\Users\xxx\AppData\Local\Temp\module_temp1859809400254981097.tmp\modulemgr.
File not found: C:\Users\xxx\AppData\Local\Temp\module_temp1859809400254981097.tmp\modulemgr.
C:\Users\xxx\AppData\Local\Temp\module_temp1859809400254981097.tmp\modulemgr (The system cannot find the path specified)

Can you try creating the module from the CLI?

http://docs.appcelerator.com/titanium/3.0/#!/guide/Titanium_Command-Line_Interface_Reference-section-35619828_TitaniumCommand-LineInterfaceReference-Create

I'd like to see if that works for you.
I am still not able to create android module trhu studio. Rather thru cli it is working. Folks its easy to say not reproduced. If you need I can get u more details.

Hello [~pravipravi]! 

Please let's do this:

0. Open your Ti Studio as administrator. 

1. Clean your logs. 
- Go to Titanium Studio
- Help menu
- Titanium Studio
- Clean log

2. Run your test. 
- Create a new mobile module project
- Name it TestModule
- If will fail.
- Go to the Help menu - > Titanium Studio -> View log.
- Paste the output as a comment here.

Thanks a lot!

It failed again. Please find log below. I assume u could get some clue from this.
